Articles.Content: I enjoy racing karts and play games
I enjoy playing KSP (no other games since I found this on steam ), astronomy, playing the guitar and dog agility.

hunting, fishing, electronics, game programming, graphic design, cats, guitar, lego, r/c helis, world annihilation and some things i cant mention in good company/around cops.

Kerbal Space Program and model railroading

Edited January 23, 2014 by mythbusters844
Neuropharmacology, TESlore and weaponry.

I have two major hobbies: Games and Music.

Games include KSP, Minecraft, emulators (SNES, DS), browser games (Pokemon Vortex, specifically), RPG/RTS/Custom (Oblivion, WC3), and a handful of shooter games (CStrike, XIII). I don't play that much today than I did before though, more into music, social and academic life now.

Music include cajon playing (aspiring drummer btw), songwriting, singing, rapping, remixing (not so much now) and FL Studio music production (more on rap beats and instrumentals, especially sampling) where I do sample beats by request. Feel free to check out my music channel to hear all of my released music-related stuff (includes samples, originals, compositions remixes, and more).

I also want to restart one of my favorite hobbies/pastimes back then: basketball
Sailing, running, climbing, football, reading, swimming, drinking. Not necessarily in that order.
Daydreaming, building stuff in sandbox games, messing around with computers and helping local folk out with PC "stuff". ( Aka, explaining to them what a password is and why you need it... )
Internetting, fishing, boating, and drinking copious amounts of water and sodas.

HamRadio ( sat chasing )

Photography and video-photography

Tesla Coils ( Large ones)

Optics ( I build LASERS)

Costume and Cosplay

Inventing.
*clears throat* Rockets,planes,planes,planes,minecraft,rocket planes,planes,did I mention I like Planes?

Lets see... KSP, KSP Forums, Minecraft, Tekkit, Minecraft with the ICBM mod, THINGS, Robotics, Modeling (3D kind not the other thing), Animation, Model Railroading, Reading, Programming, Morrowind, Modding Morrowind.
All my hobbies are full-time occupations. I manage about four. If I told you, I'd have to kill you : D
Painting, music composition, 3d modelling, miniature modeling, and of course gaming.

Rowing, cycling, nerdgasm (like KSP ), train and plane (visual, radar and radio) spotting, photography & photoshopping (Adobe, not Instacrapgram), cinema 4d (modelling), model plane building

Edited January 28, 2014 by jmiki8
KSP, duh, also Minecraft, Botany, MTG (anyone else?), DnD, YoYoing, Parkour (anyone else?), umm, I think that's it.
KSP, producing electronic music stuff, listening to music (mainly monstercat artists because they are awesome ), reading and thinking of inventions that would be stupid but also cool.
Dude i like racing and games and shooters games

train...spotting
Model Railroading

I'm not alone lol
3d printing, 3d modelling, Guitar, RC modelling, software /games development, flying quadcopters etc, painting models.. used to be into trains but it can be an expensive hobby.

Model Railroading... on the computer

I play Trainz Railroad simulator when I'm not playing World of Tanks, KSP, TF2, etc. Very relaxing, also have a few HO scale locomotives. Sometimes I go out to the Alaska Railroad station here in Anchorage, fun to see SD70's and GP40's with your own states name on them. Other times I use a phone app to see where the ISS or an Iridium sat is going to be.

https://imagizer.imageshack.us/v2/640x480q90/819/screenshot20130528at313.png (I used to use imageshack)
Thai boxing, scuba diving, sailing and poker. In that order.
Fencing and computers
Gaming, swimming, railways. Pretty expensive life style but I enjoy it so I don't really mind.
